intro: Deppea arachnipoda, commonly known as the spider-like deppea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
